title: Intro/Index
historical_context: This article serves as an introduction to Phrack Inc., a significant publication in hacker culture during the 1980s, providing a platform for various hacking-related articles and discussions.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and individuals interested in the early days of hacker culture.
short_summary: The introduction to Phrack VII outlines the purpose of the publication and clarifies misconceptions about its authorship, encouraging contributions from the community.
summary:
In this introductory piece, Taran King welcomes readers to Phrack VII and addresses common misconceptions regarding the publication. He emphasizes that Phrack Inc. is a collective effort, not solely the work of a few individuals like Knight Lightning or Cheap Shades. The article encourages readers to engage with the authors of the articles directly if they have feedback or criticisms, rather than directing their comments towards the editors. King also invites contributions from the community, highlighting the open nature of Phrack Inc. and its commitment to showcasing a variety of voices within the hacking community.

This article sets the tone for the rest of the issue, which includes a diverse range of topics related to hacking and phreaking. By fostering an inclusive environment for writers, Phrack Inc. aims to elevate the discourse around hacking and provide a platform for sharing knowledge and experiences. The introduction serves as a reminder of the collaborative spirit that defines the hacker culture of the time, encouraging readers to participate actively in the ongoing conversation.
